page.title: 18CHANGES IN THE VILLAGES
page.content: MRS.HUGHES,A TEACHER IN THE LOCALITY, WHEN INTERVIEWED REFERRED TO THE HUSTLE,BUSTLE AND ACTIVITY IN THE VILLAGES DUE TO WORK AT TWO LARGE COAL MINES,THE PARC AND THE DARE . BUSES CARRYING MINERS RATTLED DAILY UP THE MAIN ROAD. {THE MAJOR CHANGE}HAS BEEN THE CLOSURE OF THE COAL MINES AND PEOPLE HAVE LEFT THE VILLAGES TO FIND WORK.THE AREA IS QUIETER AND CLEANER.THE BLACK SILT FROM THE WASHED COAL NO LONGER FLOWS IN THE RIVER.A FORESTATION HAS TRANSFORMED THE MOUNTAIN SIDES. {THE SECOND CHANGE}HAS BEEN THE DECLINE IN THE WELSH CHAPELS,WITH ONLY A TRICKLE OF OLDER PEOPLE ATTENDING THEM.ONLY THE ROWS OF TERRACED HOUSES REMIND US OF CWMPARC AND TREORCHY'S GREAT STORY,BUT IT STILL RETAINES ITS COMMUNITY AND CARING SPIRIT.
